characters.name: Trucy Wright
characters.description1: A particular set of circumstances led to her being adopted by Mr. Wright. A world-class magician on the rise.

characters.name: Athena Cykes
characters.description1: The youngest lawyer in our agency. She apparently studied psychology in Europe.

characters.name: Phoenix Wright
characters.description1: My boss. He taught me a lot about what it means to be a lawyer.

characters.name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
characters.description1: A prosecutor from Khura'in. He's also a monk, which explains why he's known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."

characters.name: Dhurke Sahdmadhi
characters.description1: Leader of the Defiant Dragons, and the man who raised me. He was a lawyer once.

characters.name: Archie Buff
characters.description1: An archeologist in Kurain Village. He was asked by someone to study the Founder's Orb.

characters.name: Datz Are'bal
characters.description1: A member of the Defiant Dragons, and Dhurke's right-hand man. He's always been one to laugh at just about anything.

characters.name: Ema Skye
characters.description1: A detective. It looks like she finally became the forensics investigator she always wanted to be.

characters.name: Paul Atishon
characters.description1: He's looking to represent Kurain Village. His remarkable self-confidence is blinding.

characters.name: Sergeant Buff → Armie Buff
characters.description1: The doctor's reclusive child. He lost his mother in a fire.
characters.description2: The doctor's child. A self-styled sergeant. Her mother was ex-Russian military.

characters.name: Pearl Fey
characters.description1: Ms. Maya Fey's cousin. She's also one of Kurain Village's spirit mediums. She's always really courteous.

characters.name: Miles Edgeworth
characters.description1: Mr. Wright's best friend and the district's chief prosecutor. His frilly cravat makes a strong fashion statement.

characters.name: Maya Fey
characters.description1: Mr. Wright's former assistant. She's currently training in Khura'in. I'm told she can channel the dead.

characters.name: Inga Karkhuul Khura'in
characters.description1: Khura'in's Minister of Justice and the kingdom's second-in-command.
characters.description2: Khura'in's Minister of Justice and the victim in this case.

characters.name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
characters.description1: Daughter of Ga'ran and princess of Khura'in who is more than a little spoiled.

characters.name: Ga'ran Sigatar Khura'in
characters.description1: The grand priestess and queen of Khura'in. It's said that she can channel the dead.

characters.name: Nayna
characters.description1: Rayfa's attendant. She disappeared all of a sudden after Minister Inga's death.

characters.name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
characters.description1: When not undergoing monastic training, this plucky kid works as a tour guide.

characters.name: Amara Sigatar Khura'in
characters.description1: The previous queen. She is a spirit medium known as the grand priestess and possesses incredible spiritual power.

characters.name: Trucy Wright
characters.description1: An aspiring magician and my daughter. I adopted her nine years ago.

characters.name: Athena Cykes
characters.description1: The newest lawyer in my office with a background in psychology.

characters.name: Apollo Justice
characters.description1: A reliable subordinate at my office. Serious and hot-blooded with vocal chords made of steel.

characters.name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
characters.description1: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."

characters.name: Dhurke Sahdmadhi
characters.description1: Leader of the Defiant Dragons and Apollo's adoptive father.

characters.name: Datz Are'bal
characters.description1: The Defiant Dragons' XO and Dhurke's right-hand man. He will laugh at just about anything.

characters.name: Ema Skye
characters.description1: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensics investigator.

characters.name: Miles Edgeworth
characters.description1: The district's chief prosecutor and my childhood friend. We used to go head-to-head back in his courtroom days.

characters.name: Maya Fey
characters.description1: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.

characters.name: Inga Karkhuul Khura'in
characters.description1: Khura'in's Minister of Justice. He was killed during the hostage exchange.

characters.name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
characters.description1: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last memories of the dead.

characters.name: Ga'ran Sigatar Khura'in
characters.description1: The grand priestess and queen of Khura'in. It's said that she can channel the dead.

characters.name: Nayna
characters.description1: Rayfa's attendant. She disappeared all of a sudden after Minister Inga's death.

characters.name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
characters.description1: When not undergoing monastic training, this plucky kid works as a tour guide.

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: My beloved attorney's badge. Wearing it gets me raring to go.

evidences.name: Founder's Orb
evidences.description1: A national treasure of the Kingdom of Khura'in. None but those of in the royal family have laid eyes on it.
evidences.description2: Heating the Founder's Orb revealed the statue within.
evidences.description3: The founder's form has appeared from within. It seems only the queen knows the founder's real name.

evidences.name: Photo of My Father
evidences.description1: A picture of my biological father, Jove Justice, who died in Khura'in.

evidences.name: Study Photo
evidences.description1: Atishon saw Datz fleeing the scene the night of the murder. One of the books is stained with coffee.

evidences.name: Study Diagram
evidences.description1: A diagram of the doctors's study. Note the bookcase, large window, and second-floor area.

evidences.name: Research Notes
evidences.description1: Research notes on the Song of Ceremony and the box containing the Founder's Orb.

evidences.name: Orb Transfer Agreement
evidences.description1: States: "I agree to hand over the Founder's Orb to the Defiant Dragons if I will come to no harm."

evidences.name: Sarge's Drone
evidences.description1: A helicopter drone operated by the doctor's kid. Equipped with a camera and a microphone.

evidences.name: Glowing Moss
evidences.description1: Stuck to the insole of the doctor's boot. It probably got there when he went to hide the Founder's Orb.

evidences.name: E-Mail
evidences.description1: Data obtained from the doctor's computer. Includes a report on his research into the Founder's Orb.

evidences.name: Doctor's Reading Glasses
evidences.description1: The doctor's poor eyesight meant he couldn't read anything without these. They were found on his desk.

evidences.name: Raincoat
evidences.description1: Seems the doctor wore this last night. Bears a distinctive yellow and green two-tone design.

evidences.name: Robbery Report
evidences.description1: A report filed a year ago by one Mr. Paul Atishon-Wimperson for the theft of the Crystal of Ami Fey.

evidences.name: Dr. Buff's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Dr. Buff was struck with the corner of some object. The time of death is between 10 and 11 PM.

evidences.name: Armie's Statement
evidences.description1: She'd fled to her room when she realized someone had moved her while she'd been unconscious on the second floor.

evidences.name: Inga's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Stabbed from behind. Cause of death is blood loss. Time of death is approximately 3 PM.

evidences.name: Tomb Diagram
evidences.description1: A diagram of the crime scene. Amara's sarcophagus is in the very center of the room.

evidences.name: Tomb Crime Photo
evidences.description1: A photo of Inga's body. He was stabbed in the back with a knife.

evidences.name: Gemstone
evidences.description1: Inga's button, discovered in the ashes of the tomb's incense burners. Caked in soot.

evidences.name: Pink Butterfly Pendant
evidences.description1: A pendant adorned with a pink butterfly. Seems it belongs to Dhurke. Stained with the victim's blood.
evidences.description2: A locket found at the crime scene. It actually belongs to Amara.

evidences.name: Mysterious Bloodstain
evidences.description1: A bloodstain from Amara's Tomb. Analysis reveals that it's Dhurke's blood.

evidences.name: Painkiller Shots
evidences.description1: The medication Inga used for his back pain. Said to make the pain disappear.

evidences.name: Inga's Notepad
evidences.description1: A notepad used by Inga. People's characteristics are written inside.

evidences.name: Woman's Photo
evidences.description1: A photo showing Dhurke and Amara's life on the run about 23 years ago.

evidences.name: Channeling Photo
evidences.description1: A picture taken at around 2 PM of the channeling rite.

evidences.name: Ahlbi's Statement
evidences.description1: At around 2 PM, Shah'do was surprised by a firecracker, ran into the courtyard, and stole Nayna's hat.

evidences.name: Amara's Assassination File
evidences.description1: A file containing a ton of info on the assassination of Amara Sigatar Khura'in.

evidences.name: Dhurke's Law Book
evidences.description1: A document establishing the Defense Culpability Act in the name of the queen.

evidences.name: Dhurke's Badge
evidences.description1: The symbol of Dhurke's creed: "A dragon never yields." Nahyuta never confiscated it.

evidences.name: Dhurke's Corpse Photo
evidences.description1: More than three days have passed since his death death. He was shot three times in the chest.
